intro: Harpullia hillii, commonly known as the golden harpullia, is a tropical tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
